result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhonda Kay Pfenning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:59 a.m.  Defendant Rhonda Kay Pfenning in court.   No other appearances.  Court addreses Ms. Phenning.  Asking for extension of fine.  Court reviews Community Services option with defendant.  Phenning would be able to pay $25.00 per month starting October 1, 2017.  Court - Amount that is eligible for payment by Community Service may be done through Community Service, remainder to be paid by Ms. Phenning at the rate of $25.00 per month beginning October 1, 2017. 12:02 p.m.
Indigency hearing on July 19, 2017 at 11:45 am.

4:20 Defendant Rhonda Kay Pfenning in court with attorney Adam P Nero.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich  - Plead to Ct 1   $453.fine.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1  Court orders Fine of $ 253.00 DNA $200.oosurcharge and sample.

10:41 Defendant Rhonda Kay Pfenning in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Adam Nero appeared in court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Court gives constitutional rights to the court room as a group. Each Defendant in a group exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter. Froelich: $2000 signature bond. Nero has no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 10:45 am.
